Knowledge Representation

Using the Agudeza Ontology to represent knowledge

Representing Knowledge Using the Agudeza Ontology

In order to represent knowledge using the Agudeza Ontology, the ontology has been used to create, populate, and visualise an RDF knowledge graph to represent the agudeza-universe of each of the 3 initial critics. It is worth noting that the Agudeza Ontology is applicable to any critic of the Agudeza and the same steps could be taken to represent the agudeza-universe of any other critical analysis.

In each of the following sections, the Python code via which each knowldege graph was created is provided, alongside its RDF serialisation in Turtle format, and a graph visualisation. These Python and ttl files are available here.

Without yet moving onto the stage of Knowledge Extraction, the representation of knowledge related to the domain of critical debate surrounding Graci√°n's Agudeza allows us to see that the state of scholarship on the Agudeza has significantly advanced, having become patently more intricate and nuanced, since Sarmiento's 1932 article.
